results.title: Military Residency Choice Act
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) Military Residency Choice Act  (Sec. 2) This bill amends the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act to permit the spouse of a service member to elect to use the same residence as the service member for purposes of taxation and voting, regardless of the date on which the marriage of the spouse and the service member occurred.
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.) Military Residency Choice Act  (Sec. 2) This bill amends the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act to permit the spouse of a service member to elect to use the same residence as the service member for purposes of taxation and voting, regardless of the date on which the marriage of the spouse and the service member occurred.

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H6170)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6198)
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H6170-6171)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Walz objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 282.
Mr. Roe (TN) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 177.
Reported by the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. H. Rept. 115-245.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote .
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
